titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Katherine Binney Shippen (1892-1980) was a 1914 graduate of Bryn Mawr College. She was an author, primarily of children's books. Her titles include The Great Heritage, A Bridle for Pegasus, The Pool of Knowledge, and The Heritage of Music. In 1924 she made a journey to China and Japan, with stops on the way home in Southeast Asia, India, Africa, and Europe.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the papers of Katherine Shippen. Materials include: manuscripts; correspondence with editors; scrapbooks of reviews of her work; photograph albums of trips to San Francisco and Asia; a narrative of her trip to China entitled "With a Sense of Wonder"; memorabilia from her time at Bryn Mawr College; a cassette and transcript of an interview with Shippen; and a key to the City of Hoboken, her hometown.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: University of Southern Mississippi: Katherine Binney Shippen papers.
